## Hello Typst: <https://typst.app>

![](img/typst-app.jpg)

::: {.notes}

An entirely new system for producing PDF documents.

Quarto 1.4 provides `typst` as a new output format. You still write Markdown,
but you get a number of very exciting things

:::

## Why I'm excited about Typst

- Much, *much* better error messages

- Much, *much* easier to write extensions and new templates

- No LaTeX dependency to install: we bundle `typst` with Quarto

- the other 5%: I will tell you about sharp edges

# Quarto, meet `typst`

::: {.notes}

Show a basic typst document in quarto.

:::

## {.notes}

At the most basic level, replace `pdf` with `typst` in the format, and you're good to go.

##

# Error messages matter

::: notes

Quarto calls downstream tools directly. When something fails, 
we either have to fix it ourselves by parsing the error message (mklatex etc) or we report the error.

We put a _lot_ of effort in producing good error messages, but there's only so much we can do.

:::

# No LaTeX

## No `tinytex` required: quarto bundles `typst`

::: notes

Locked-down corporate environment? We gotchu fam

:::

## Typst is fast!

::: notes

One fairly annoying thing about Quarto is that it's kind of slow (acknowledge and mention 2023 speed fixes, as well as 2024). With PDF output from LaTeX, it's that much slower. But Typst is very fast! (Demo.)

:::
